quest.name: Seeds of Despair
journal: If you seek further employment, Alphinaud can point you in the right direction.
objectives: Search for imperial patrols south of Prism Lake.
Search Prism Lake for imperial patrols.
Search the Ribbons for suspicious villagers.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: So much to do, and so little time to do it...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: During the rebellion, the imperials turned to their agents among the shinobi, and through their treachery were many of my comrades slaughtered.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: We few who survived have not forgotten that day. The memory of it has spurred us never to neglect our training, that we might be ready to administer revenge.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Should you wish for further employment, mayhap you could speak with Alisaie?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I believe she was planning to search the surrounding area for imperial patrols. If you go now, you may be able to catch her before she departs.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Dairyu Moon Gates have guarded the approach to Doma Castle since long before the imperial occupation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We do not anticipate any great difficulty in gaining entry to the gatehouse as our Doman friends know its every nook and cranny. The challenge will come in preserving the element of surprise. But I am confident the shinobi will rise to the occasion.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Alphinaud told you about my plans? And you wish to come with me? Well, far be it from me to refuse you.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If truth be told, I'm not entirely sure what I expect to find. In the wake of your failed assassination attempt, the imperials demonstrated uncharacteristic restraint. There were no public executions, and not a single village was put to the torch.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But, as I mentioned earlier, our latest intelligence does suggest a purge is imminent. For all we know, they could be out in the field even as we speak, surveilling their targets and making plans.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: If so, we need to put a stop to it. Let us begin our search in the north.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This is the place. Do you see anything or anyone of note?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: All quiet...for now. Follow me to the next location.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: This was the second point I marked on my map...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: No imperial patrols near our headquarters, then. Good. The last thing we need is a repeat of Rhalgr's Reach.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Even so, 'twould be prudent to search a little longer.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Not exactly the enemy I was worried about. <sigh> ...Damn it all. I can't just leave the carcass lying in the middle of the road.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: You've gotten stronger.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Get on with it, then.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...Next to you, I feel like a child playing at swords and sorcery. Though mayhap it suits me better than books.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I owe much to a Miqo'te I met on my travels. He was a master of these techniques, and kindly agreed to teach me the fundamentals.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But I never could warm to common rapiers. I vastly preferred using a blade of my own creation, despite the toll it took on me. Urianger's gift was a godssend, to be honest.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...I didn't mean to imply that you should help me. This isn't the first wild beast we've had to slay to keep the people safe in your absence.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: But we'll need all the help we can get when the real fighting starts...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Anyway, we're falling behind. We should split up, and try to recoup some lost time.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We've heard rumors of imperial soldiers skulking about disguised as villagers. One was supposedly spotted near the Ribbons, to the south of here. Go and see if there's anything out of the ordinary.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I'll come and find you when I've dealt with this carcass. If you run afoul of imperials, call out and I'll be there that much sooner.

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: Oh... Hello there, young ladyman. My associates and I are in search of fertile soil for farming, and this land caught our eye.

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: ...You doubt my words? You suspect we have some other purpose in coming here? <sigh> How vexing it is to be questioned in this manner.

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: Very well. SheHe desires the truth, and shehe shall have it. Deal with herhim!

dialogue.name: POP
dialogue.text: The two men draw their swords and charge!

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: Ugh...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I saw them attack you, while this one fled. Since you seemed to have everything in hand, I decided to capture him. An imperial, I presume?

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: I knew it would come to this... But at the hands of a Westerner? A Doman would at least know the rites...

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: You think you understand, but you do not. She will burn it all before she surrenders. She will never kneel again. Nor should she...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Forename!

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: ...Rest assured, the Naeuri will receive due compensation. Young Asahi has great potential─that much is plain.

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: If he applies himself, he may one day be granted the opportunity to go to Garlemald and learn from some of the leading authorities in the field of magitek. Few citizens are afforded such treatment, however─much less people of the provinces. You will need to do more─

dialogue.name: YOTSUYUSMOM
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, of course! Have no doubt that we shall! My husband and I want only the best imperial education for our boy!

dialogue.name: YOTSUYU
dialogue.text: (-Starveling Girl-)I've finished planting the rice, Mother...

dialogue.name: YOTSUYUSMOM
dialogue.text: Not while the officer is here, Yotsuyu! Inside! Now!

dialogue.name: YOTSUYU
dialogue.text: Yes, Mother.

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: You did not mention that you had a daughter.

dialogue.name: YOTSUYUSMOM
dialogue.text: My sister's, not mine─kami rest her soul. <sigh> She is utterly hopeless, but one cannot choose one's family.

dialogue.name: HENSO02520
dialogue.text: Indeed... She is of age to receive an education as well, is she not? Yet we have no records. I trust I need not remind you of your legal obligations─

dialogue.name: YOTSUYUSMOM
dialogue.text: No, no! Of course not! But she is weak and sickly. Some days, she has not the strength to leave her bed! Though...a thought occurs to me. Mayhap we can come to an understanding...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: That was a near thing.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What happened? We were talking, and then all of a sudden you were somewhere else. Did one of those soldiers hit you on the head or something?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Well, if you say so... We should go and tell the others what happened here.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: Everything all right?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Thank you. You didn't have to come with me, but you did, and for that I am grateful.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I told the others of our encounter with the disguised soldiers. Though we disposed of the bodies, it is only a matter of time before their comrades note their absence.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text:
As if we needed any more reason to act quickly...
Are you sure you're all right, by the way? You've been awfully quiet since we returned...

obj.n: How Tataru Got Her Groove Back
